definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
to sew together/suture (in surgery)/to sew up (a wound)
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
to fit tightly (idiom)/to join seamlessly/to fit snugly

sentences.english: And makes gaps even two can pass abreast.
sentences.chinese: 使牆裂了縫，二人並肩都走得過。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to give you a few stiches.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得給你縫幾針了。

sentences.english: Among the Basic techniques are cross-stitch, crewel work, and quilting.
sentences.chinese: 最基本的技巧是十字針鏽和絎縫繡。

sentences.english: The upper and lower axis adopts spiraling bevel gear, cylindrical seaming stand and rolling press foot, which is convenient for vertical and zig-zag seaming.
sentences.chinese: 採用立柱式縫臺及滾輪壓腳，可方便地進行立曲縫製。

sentences.english: All back rise seams should be two-thread chain stitch or double row lock stitch.
sentences.chinese: 所有後檔縫應當用雙針鏈式縫跡或雙行鎖式線跡。

sentences.english: Hong Luo thin Pteris several heavy, Bi Wen night dome slit.
sentences.chinese: 鳳尾香羅薄幾重，碧文圓頂夜深縫。

sentences.english: She opened the door just a crack to listen to the talking.
sentences.chinese: 她把門開了一條縫聽人談話。

sentences.english: B stitch in time saves nine.
sentences.chinese: 即時縫一針省患上未來縫九針。

sentences.english: B stitch in time saves nine.
sentences.chinese: 即時縫一針省患上未來縫九針。

sentences.english: The hospital went seaming a few needles after my hand is broken by glass.
sentences.chinese: 我手被玻璃砸傷後去醫院縫了幾針。

sentences.english: Another one helped to sew the button onto his shirt.
sentences.chinese: 另一個隊員幫他把釦子縫在襯衣上。

sentences.english: Black quilted tech fabric with tonal felt trim.
sentences.chinese: 黑色絎縫高科技面料與色調感覺修剪。

sentences.english: The mapper trapped in the gap tapped the tap wrapper with strap.
sentences.chinese: 陷在縫中的製圖者用皮帶輕擊塞子套套。

sentences.english: A stich in time saves embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 及時縫一針，免得再走光。

sentences.english: A long whip stitch or overhand stitch overlying an edge to prevent raveling.
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止散開而包着邊兒縫的一種縫法。

definition: pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)
Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
one block/one piece/one (unit of money)/together/in the same place/in company
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
